DataElement.preferredName: Alcohol Past Month Consumption Quantity Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Questions asking the respondent about quantity of alcohol consumption during the past 30 days [Manually curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Questions asking the respondent about quantity of alcohol consumption during the past 30 days [Manually curated]

Concepts.definition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.

Property.preferredDefinition: Past; before the present time.:One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:The bodily process of taking in and using up something, especially the eating or drinking of something.:Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
The bodily process of taking in and using up something, especially the eating or drinking of something.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A category of organic or inorganic substances, elements, and isotopes used in research or for the prevention, diagnosis, and/or treatment of disease states. Includes biologically active substances that are either synthetically manufactured or endogenous substances extracted and processed to be reintroduced into an organism. Chemicals and drugs also include hazardous substances, and naturally occurring or synthetically produced substances required to maintain life.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
